title: Introducing: J Biscuits
content:
The 23rd release on Erik Hidde’s Housewarming Records comes from New York producer J Biscuits, and it’s a refreshingly unique listen.

Whilst many modern producers chose to remain entirely electronic, and shun what were previously perceived to be conventional methods, J Biscuits strength lies within his adaptation of the natural. Whether it be the solemnly haunting clarinet or the tribal-esque swing of Spiced Rum, James Broughton clearly understands the complexity yet benefit of keeping his music grounded.

His debut EP Quests is a stimulating listen, flexing it’s inner beauty throughout it’s six track run length. It reminds me of driving down a street of high rise buildings, and catching glimpses of other paths of life down the various intersections that flash by, all too fleeting yet memorable. Stream my personal favourite, Attacked By Panthers below, and head over to the Housewarming Records bandcamp for a full download.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
